Fusions - order does matter

Spawned balls from {[spawner]} have the same properties as {[fused]}
---

If Ball A or Ball B is a Ball Spawner, the spawned balls will inherit the properties of the other ball.

Example: Spawned balls from Brood Mother have the same properties as Hemorrhage
---

mosquito_combo_details
Mosquitoes also inflict hit effects from {[fused]} when hitting an enemy
---

If Ball A or Ball B is Mosquito, the mosquitoes will inflict the hit effects of the other ball upon hitting an enemy.

Example: Mosquitoes also inflict hit effects from Hemorrhage when hitting an enemy
---

glacier_combo_details
Glacial Spikes apply the hit effects from {[fused]} when touching an enemy
---

If Ball A or Ball B is Glacier, the Glacial Spikes will apply the hit effects of the other ball upon touching an enemy.

Example: Glacial Spikes apply the hit effects from Hemorrhage when touching an enemy
---

aoe_hiteff_combo_details
Area-of-effect damage from {[aoe]} also inflicts status effects from {[hiteff]}
---

If Ball A or Ball B has an area-of-effect (AOE) damage component, the AOE damage will also inflict the status effects of the other ball upon hitting an enemy. If both balls have AOE damage, the AOE from Ball A will inflict the status effects from Ball B.

Example: Area-of-effect damage from Laser also inflicts status effects from Hemorrhage
---
